title: Lockup in time.stopTimer
body:
by **Jens.Alfke**: 
A specific set of events involving a Timer and Ticker causes the current goroutine to
lock up.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
Run the attached program, i.e.:
$ go run hang.go

What is the expected output?
Something starting like this:
2013/06/20 15:57:46 About to panic...
2013/06/20 15:57:46 About to stop Ticker
2013/06/20 15:57:46 Stopped Ticker
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
...

What do you see instead?
The program hangs after logging the following:
2013/06/20 15:57:21 About to panic...
2013/06/20 15:57:21 About to stop Ticker


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
"go" tool, version 1.1.1

Which operating system are you using?
Mac OS X 10.8.4

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1.1 darwin/amd64


Please provide any additional information below.
The bug requires both the call to the nil Timer, as well as stopping a (valid) Ticker in
a 'defer' handler. If either of those are changed, the bug stops reproducing. (I have
some commented-out lines at the end of the function that can be used instead of the
Timer lines to induce a more normal segfault, to demonstrate this.)
